perturbation.original_text: 1.1 The following words shall have the following meanings throughout this Agreement:                 a)    "Agreement" means this Agreement and all Schedules annexed hereto,            as amended from time to time by the Parties;
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 The following words shall have the following meanings throughout this Agreement, except as otherwise specified in individual sections:                 a)    "Agreement" means this Agreement and all Schedules annexed hereto,            as amended from time to time by the Parties;
perturbation.explanation: The original definition section states the definitions apply 'throughout this agreement.' The modified version adds 'except as otherwise specified in individual sections,' opening the door to conflicting definitions in other clauses.

perturbation.original_text: 3.4     Each Party agrees to provide the services outlined above at an on time         performance level of no less than ninety percent (90%) of the scheduled         delivery time, excluding delays caused by the other Party or events of          Force Majeure. Monthly, the performance level shall be measured as set          out above. Failure to provide services as set out herein constitutes a          Monthly Service Failure.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4     Each Party agrees to provide the services outlined above at an on time         performance level of no less than ninety percent (90%) of the scheduled         delivery time, excluding delays caused by the other Party.  Monthly, the performance level shall be measured based on mutually agreed upon metrics to be defined and adjusted quarterly by both parties. Failure to provide services as set out herein *may* constitute a Monthly Service Failure, subject to review and negotiation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a clear, quantitative definition of 'on time performance.' The modified version introduces ambiguity by removing the mention of 'Force Majeure' and stating that the measurement will be based on mutually agreed upon metrics, to be adjusted quarterly, that were not in the original agreement, and by making a service failure 'may' instead of definitively being one, making contract enforcement difficult and creating dispute over what actually constitutes a Monthly Service Failure.

perturbation.original_text: 20.1    Any notice or other communication with respect to this Agreement shall         be in writing and shall be effectively given if delivered, or sent         (postage or other charges prepaid) by letter, facsimile or electronic         means addressed:
perturbation.changed_text: 20.1    Any notice or other communication with respect to this Agreement shall         be in writing and shall be effectively given if delivered, or sent         (postage or other charges prepaid) by letter, facsimile or electronic         means addressed, except for urgent operational matters, which may be communicated verbally with electronic confirmation to follow:
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates written communication. The modified version introduces an exception for 'urgent operational matters,' allowing verbal communication under certain circumstances. This introduces ambiguity, as there are no guidelines for what constitutes 'urgent' and 'electronic confirmation' is undefined and could be disputed. This contradicts the original strict requirement for written notices, leading to potential legal disputes over notification validity.
